unde placitum Conventionis factum fuit inter (...) in eadem Curia, scilicet
quod praedictus Radulphus recognovit praedicta Maneria and tenementa cum
pertinentiis esse jus ipsius Willielmi Islip, ut illa quae iidem Willielmus,
Willielmus Marshall, Nicolaus and Willielmus Aldwyncle habent de dono praedicti
Radulphi, and pro hac recognitione, fine and concordia iidem Willielmus,
Willielmus, Nicolaus and Willelmus concesserunt praedictis Radulpho and
Katherinae uxori ejus praedicta Maneria and tenementa cum pertinentiis, and
illa eis reddiderunt in eadem Curia: Habenda and tenenda eisdem Radulpho and
Katherinae and haeredibus ipsius Radulphi de corpore suo procreatis de
praedictis Willielmo, Willielmo, Nicolao and Willielmo and haeredibus ipsius
Willielmi Islip imperpetuum; Reddendo inde per Annum unam Rosam ad Festum
Nativitatis Sancti Johannis Baptistae pro omni servitio, consuetudinibus and
exactione ad praedictos Willielmum, Willielmum, Nicolaum and Willielmum and
haeredes ipsius Willielmi Islip pertinente, and faciendo inde capitalibus
Dominis feodi illius pro praedictis Willielmo, Willielmo, Nicolao and Willielmo
and haeredibus ipsius Willielmi Islip omnia alia servitia quae ad praedicta
Maneria and tenementa pertinent imperpetuum. Et si contingat quod idem
Radulphus obierit sine haeredibus de corpore suo procreatis, tunc post decessum
ipsorum Radulphi and Katherinae praedicta Maneria and tenementa cum
pertinentiis integre revertantur ad praedictos Willielmum, Willielmum, Nicolaum
and Willielmum and haeredes ipsius Willielmi Islip quiet de aliis haeredibus
praedictorum Radulphi and Katherinae, tenenda de Capitalibus Dominis feodi
illius per servitia quae ad praedicta Maneria and tenementa pertinent
imperpetuum.

Inquisitio capta post mortem Radulphi Green.
INquisitio capta apud Thrapston die Martis proximo post Festum Sancti Hilarii
Anno Regni Regis Henrici Quinti post Conquestum quinto, coram Johanne Spriggy
Escaetore Domini Regis in Comitatu Northamptoniae, virtute cujusdam brevis
Domini Regis eidem Escaetori directi and huic Inquisitioni consuti, per
Sacramentum, etc. Qui dicunt super Sacramentum suum, quod Radulphus Green in
dicto brevi Domini Regis nominatus nulla terras seu tenementa tenuit de Domino
Rege in Capite dicto die quo obiit in Dominico suo ut de feodo nec in servitio
in Comitatu praedicto, sed dicunt quod praedictus Radulphus tenuit die quo
obiit conjunctim feoffatus cum Katherina uxore sua adhuc superstite Maneria de
Drayton, Luffwick, Houghton, Cotes and Raundes, ac sex Virgatas terrae and tria
Cotagia in Harringworth cum pertinentiis in Comitatu praedicto ex concessione
Willielmi Islip Parsonae Ecclesiae de Conyngton, Willielmi Marshall Parsonae
Ecclesiae de Rothing, Nicolai Morice and Willielmi Aldwyncle per quandam Finem
in Curia Domini Regis de Maneriis and tenementis praedictis inter praefatos
Willielmum Islip, Willielmum Marshal, Nicolaum and Willielmum Aldwyncle
Querentes and praefatos Radulphum and Katherinam Deforcientes levatam: Tenenda
eisdem Radulpho and Katherinae and haeredibus de corpore praedicti Radulphi
procreatis de praedictis Willielmo Islip, Willielmo Marshall, Nicolao and
Willielmo Aldwyncle and haeredibus ipsius Willielmi Islip imperpetuum, Reddendo
inde per annum unam Rosam ad Festum Nativitatis Sancti Johannis Baptistae pro
omni servitio, consuetudinibus and exactione ad praefatos Willielmum Islip,
Willielmum Marshall, Nicolaum and Willielmum Aldwyncle and haeredes ipsius
Willielmi Islip imperpetuum pertinentibus, Et faciendo inde Capitalibus Dominis
feodi illius pro dictis Willielmo Islip, Willielmo Marshall, Nicolao and
Willielmo Aldwyncle and haeredibus ipsius Willielmi Islip omnia alia servitia
quae ad praedicta Maneria and tenementa pertinent imperpetuum. Et si contingat
quod idem Radulphus obierit sine haeredibus de corpore suo procreatis, tunc
post decessum ipsorum Radulphi and Katherinae, Maneria praedicta and tenementa
cum pertinentiis integre revertantur ad praedictos Willielmum Islip, Willielmum
Marshall, Nicolaum and Willielmum Aldwyncle and haeredes ipsius Willielmi Islip
quieta de aliis haeredibus praedictorum Radulphi and Katherinae, Tenenda de
Capitalibus Dominis feodi illius per servitia quae ad praedicta Maneria and
tenementa pertinent imperpetuum. Item praefati Juratores dicunt quod dictum
Manerium de Drayton cum pertinentiis tenetur de Johanna Regina Angliae ut de
Manerio suo de Gerdington per servitium reddendi per annum tresdecim solidos
and quatuor denarios and sectam Curiae pro omni servitio; Et valet per annum
ultra reprisas quadraginta solidos. Et quod dictum Manerium de Luffwick tenetur
de Thoma Green Milite per servitium militare, and valet per annum ultra
reprisas december libras. Et quod praedictum Manerium de Houghton cum pertinentiis
tenetur de praefato Thoma Green per servitium militare, and valet per annum
ultra reprisas centum solidos. Et quod Maneria de Cotes and Raundes tenentur de
dicto Thoma Green per servitium militare, and quod valent per Annum ultra
reprisas quatuordecim libras. Ac etiam dicunt quod dictae sex Virgatae terrae
and tria Cotagia in Harringworth cum pertinentiis tenentur de Domino le Zouch
per servitium militare, and valent per Annum ultra reprisas tres libras. Et
ulterius dicunt quod praedictus Radulphus non tenuit aliqua alia terras seu
tenementa die quo obiit de Domino Rege in Capite nec de aliquo alio in Comitatu
praedicto. Ac etiam dicunt quod idem Radulphus obiit vicesimo quarto die
Octobris ultimo praeterito. Et quod Johannes Green Armiger frater dicti
Radulphi est haeres ejus propinquior, and aetatis triginta annorum and amplius.
In cujus rei testimonium, etc.

Indentura inter Katherinam uxorem Radulphi Green and Thomam Prentys and
Robertum Sutton de Chelaston, Kervers.
CEste Endentre faite perentres Katherine que fuist la feme Rauf Green
Esquier, William Aldwyncle and William Marchall Clerk d'un part, and Thomas
Prentys and Robert Sutton de Chelaston en Count de Derbie Kervers, d'autre
part testmoigne, que les ditz Kervers ount covenantez and empris pur fair and
entailler bien, honestement and profitablement, une tomb de piere appelle
alabastre bon, fyn and pure, contenent en longure ix pees d'assise, and en
largure iiij pees and deux d'assise, sur quele tomb seront faitz deux images
d'alabastre, l'un counterfeit a un Esquier en Arms en toutz pointz, contenent
en lo ngure vij pees d'assise, avec un helm de soubs son chief, and un ours a
ses pees, and l'autre image serra countrefait a une dame gisant en sa surcote
overte, avec deux Anges tenants un pilow de soubz sa test, and deux petitz
chiens a ses pees, l'un des ditz images tenant l'autre per la main, avec deux
tabernacles appelles gablettes a lour testes, quele tomb conteindra per les
costs avec le leggement trois pees d'assife, sur queux costs seront images
d'Anges ove tabernacles portantz escutz, selont la devise des ditz Katherine,
William and William. Et auxi ferront les ditz Kervers un arche d'alabastre
amounte tout la dite tomb, en longure, and largure, avec pendantz and knottes,
and une crest de foytes and autre ourages appertinent au tiele tomb, les queux
image tomb and arche serront proportionez endorres peintes and arraies ove
colors bien and sufficientment en le pure honest and profitable manner come
appertient a tiel overage. Et seront toutz les ditz overages prestment faitz,
and perfourmez, en toutz poyntz, en manner suisdite, and surmis and enhaute,
per les ditz Thomas and Robert en l'esglise parochiel de Luffwick, en Count de
Northamton, as costages and peril des ditz Thomas and Robert, en toutz maneres
chooses, perentre cy and le fest de Pasque serra l'en de grace Mccccxx. Pur
quelles overages en manner avantdit affair and performers les ditz Katherine,
William, and William, paieront ou feront paier as ditz Thomas and Robert ou
l'autre deulx; quarant livers desterlings, don't seront paiez al fesance di
cestes dys marcs and al fest de Pasque ore prochein avener dix marcs, and al
fest del Nativite de Seint John Baptiftre adonque prochein ensuant, dys marcs
and at fest de Saint Michell adonque prochein ensuant dys marcs, and les dix
marcs remanantz seront paiez quant toutz les ditz overages seront faitz and
surmys, en manner avantdit; pur toutz quelles convenantz avantditz and chescun
deulx, de part les ditz Thomas and Robert faites, a performer mesmes Thomas and
Robert eux obligent, and chescun deulx per soy, en lentier, lour heirs and
executors as ditz Katherine, William, and William, en cessant livres per y
cestes. En tesmoignance de quele chose les parties avantditz a y cestes
Endentres enterchangeablement ount myslours Sealx. Done le xiiij jour le
Feverer l'an du Regne du Roy Henry Quint puis le Conquest sisme.

The Tomb of Rauf Green Lord of Drayton Extant in the Church of St. Peter in
Luffwick in ye County of Nerthampton.
tomb of Sir Ralph and Catherine (nee Malory) Green

JOHN GREEN, Lord of Drayton and other Lands and Lordships.
Carta Willielmi Seymour.
NOverint Universi per Praesentes me Willielmum Seymour de Halton juxta
Spillesby remisisse, relaxasse, and omnino pro me and haeredibus meis
imperpetuum quietum clamasse Johanni Green quondam filio Henrici Green de
Drayton Militis totum jus meum and clameum quae unquam habui, habeo, seu quovis
modo habere potero in omnibus terris and tenementis, redditibus and servitiis,
pratis, pascuis and pasturis, cum omnibus and singulis suis pertinentiis infra
Comitatum Northamptoniae; Ita videlicet quod nec Ego praedictus Willielmus nec
haeredes mei nec aliquis alius nomine nostro aliquod jus seu clameum in
praedictis terris and tenementis, redditibus and servitiis, pratis, pascuis and
pasturis cum omnibus and singulis suis pertinentiis de caetero exigere seu
vendicare poterimus in suturum, sed ab omni action juris and Clamei inde
maneamus exclusi per Praesentes. Et ego praedictus Willielmus Seymour and
haeredes mei omnia praedicta terras and tenementa, redditus and servitia,
prata, pascua and pasturas cum omnibus and singulis suis pertinentiis praefato
Johanni Green, haeredibus and assignatis suis in forma praedicta contra omnes
gentes warrantizabimus and defendemus imperpetuum. In cujus rei testimonium
huic praesenti Scripto Sigillum meum apposui.

Dat' apud Halton die Lunae in Crastino Sanctae Trinitatis Anno Regni Regis
Henrici Quarti post Conquestum septimo.
Carta Regis Henrici Sexti.
HEnricus Dei gratia Rex Angliae and Franciae and Dominus Hiberniae
omnibus Ballivis and fidelibus suis ad quos praesentes, Literae pervenerint
Salutem.
Sciatis quod de gratia nostra speciali pardonavimus Johanni Green de Comitatu
Northamptoniae Armigero sectam pacis nostrae quae ad nos versus ipsum pertinet
pro omnimodis proditionibus, insurrectionibus, rebellionibus and feloniis per
ipsum ante nonum diem Aprilis ultimo praeteritum qualitercunque factis sive
perpetratis (murdris and raptu mulierum exceptis) unde indictatus, rectatus vel
appellatus existit; ac etiam Utlagariis si quae in ipsum hiis occasionibus
fuerint promulgatae; Et firmam pacem nostram ei inde concedimus; Ita tamen quod
idem Johannes dicto nono die Aprilis in prisona absque manucaptione seu
traditione in Ballivum pro causis praedictis vel aliqua earundem detentus non
fuerit nec probatus aut dampnatus, and quod stet rectus in curia nostra si qui
versus eum loqui voluerint de praemissis vel aliquo praemissorum, forisfacturis
tamen terrarum and tenementorum ac Bonorum and Catallorum Nobis in hac part
incursis, si quae fuerint, nobis semper salvis. Et ulterius de uberiori gratia
pardonavimus and remisimus praefato Johanni sectam nostram quae ad nos versus
ipsum pertinet pro omnibus catallis felonum and fugitivorum minime de recordo,
ac omnimodis transgressionibus, negligentiis, misprisionibus and contemptibus,
ac omnimoda venditione boscorum infra bundas forestarum nostrarum, omnimodisque
transgressionibus de viridi and venatione infra forestas nostras and porellias
earundem, ac omnimodis finibus pro transgressionibus minime adjudicatis, Necnon
omnimodis concelamentis per ipsum ante primum diem ultimi Parliamenti nostri,
videlicet quintum decimum diem Maii ultimo praeteritum, factis and perpetratis;
(Concelamentis illis si quae per ipsum dum Officiarius noster vel carissimi
Domini and patris nostri defuncti computabilis extitit facta fuerint, exceptis)
Unde indictatus vel rectatus existit; Ac etiam Utlagarias si quae in ipsum hiis
occasionibus fuerint promulgatae, and firmam pacem nostram ei inde concedimus.
Pardonavimus etiam and remisimus eidem Johanni omnimodas donationes,
alienationes and perquisitiones per inpsum de terris and tenementis de Nobis in
Capite tentis sine licentia regia ante praedictum quintum decimum diem Maii
factas; Necnon omnimodos ingressus si qui in haereditatem suam post mortem
Antecessorum suorum absque prosecutione ejusdem per debitum processum extra
manus Regias ante eundem quintum decimum diem Maii facti existant: exceptis
illis terris and tenementis quae ad manum mortuam absque licentia regia
alienantur. Ita tamen quod idem Johannes unus de illis Officiariis vel
Ministris misterae monetae, cunagii vel excambii in Turri and Civitate nostris
London and in Villa Cales, qui ad standum recto super hiis quae sibi
objicientur, securitatem Nobis in Cancellaria nostra non invenerint, quos
propter certos defectus and impetitiones communem utilitatem populi nostri
manifest concernent' gaudere nolumus, non existat. In cujus rei testimonium
has Literas nostras fieri fecimus Patentes.

Test meipso apud Westmonasterium vicesimo die Decembris Anno Regni nostri
primo. Manpus. Per ipsum Regem.

Carta Johannis Green.
SCiant praesentes and futuri quod Ego Johannes Green Armiger dedi, concessi
and hac praesenti Carta mea confirmavi Philippo Morgon Episcopo Eliensi, Thomae
Sydenill, Willielmo Tresham, Waltero Green, Thomae Cotton, Roberto Isham,
Willielmo Aldwyncle and Johanni Warner totum Manerium meum de Grafton in
Comitatu Northamptoniae, cum omnibus terris, tenementis, redditibus,
reversionibus, servitiis, wardis, maritagiis, releviis, herietis, Escaetis
pratis, pascuis, pasturis, boscis, aquis, piscariis, una cum advocatione
Ecclesiae de Grafton praedicta cum omnibus aliis pertinentiis dicto Manerio
spectantibus: Habendum and tenendum praedictum Manerium cum omnibus terris,
tenementis, redditibus, reversionibus, servitiis, wardis, maritagiis, releviis,
herietis, Escaetis, pratis, pascuis, pasturis, boscis, aquis, piscariis, una
cum advocatione Ecclesiae praedictae and omnibus aliis pertinentiis suis ut
praedictum est, praefatis Philippo, Thomae, Willielmo, Waltero, Thomae,
Roberto, Willielmo and Johanni Warner, haeredibus and assignatis eorum
imperpetuum, de Capitalibus Dominis feodi illius per servitia inde debita and
de jure consueta. Et Ego vero praedictus Johannes Green and haeredes mei
praedictum Manerium cum omnibus terris, tenementis, redditibus, reversionibus,
servitiis, wardis, maritagiis, releviis, herietis, escaetis, pratis, pascuis,
pasturis, boscis, aquis, piscariis, una cum advocatione Ecclesiae praedictae
and omnibus aliis pertinentiis suis, praefatis Philippo, Thomae, Willielmo,
Waltero, Thomae, Roberto, Willielmo and Johanni Warner, haeredibus and
assignatis eorum contra omnes gentes Warrantizabimus imperpetuum. In cujus rei
testimonium huic praesenti Cartae meae Sigillum meum apposui.

Dat' apud Grafton praedictam vicesimo septimo die mensis Januarii, Anno Regni
Regis Henrici Sexti post Conquestum undecimo. Hiis Testibus Johanne Bever,
Johanne Green de Sudburgh, Johanne Duffyn, Roberto Fisher, Petro Andrewe and
multis aliis. seal of Sir John Green SIGILLVM IOHANNIS GRENE



Carta Johannis Green.
NOverint Universi per Praesentes me Johannem Green Armigerum ordinasse,
fecisse and loco meo posuisse Dilectum mihi in Christo Johannem Trayle Clericum
Attornatum meum specialem ad liberandum nomine meo Philippo Morgon Episcopo
Eliensi, Thomae Wydevyll, Willielmo Tresham, Waltero Green, Thomae Cotton,
Roberto Isham, Willielmo Aldwyncle and Johanni Warner plenam and pacificam
seisinam in and de Manerio de Graston in Comitatu Northamptoniae cum omnibus
terris, tenementis, redditibus, reversionibus, servitiis, wardis, maritagiis,
releviis, herietis, escaetis, pratis, pascuis, pasturis, boscis, aquis,
piscariis, una cum advocatione Ecclesiae de Grafton praedicta and omnibus aliis
pertinentiis suis secundum vim, formam and effectum cujusdam Cartae meae
simplicis feodi inde eis confectae: Ratum habiturus and gratum id quod dictus
Attornatus meus nomine meo fecerit in praemissis per Praesentes Sigillo meo
Signatas.

Dat' vicesimo septimo die mensis Januarii Anno Regni Regis Henrici Sexti post
Conquestum undecimo.
Ultima Voluntas Johannis Green.
IN Dei nomine, Amen. This is the Will of me John Green of Herdwyk Esquire,
made the twenty eight day of January, the eleventh year of King Herry VI. First
I will that Margaret my Wife have the term of her life my Manners of Herdwyk
and Grafton, with the avowson of the Church of Grafton and all the
appurtenances, and with all my Londs, Tenements and Rents with the
appurtenances in Irtlyngburgh in Northhamptonshire; and the Manner of Grateley
with the avowson of the Church and the appurtenances in Hampshire, with the
Manner of Matherne in Wales with the appurtenances: And I will that my Feoffes
anon after my Decease maken sufficient and sure estate to the said Margaret my
Wife of the Manners, Lands, Tenements and Rents abovesaid with avowsons and all
the appurtenances during her life without empeachment of any waste, what time
my said Feoffes or any of them by the said Margaret or by her Council been
required. Also I will that anon after the decease of the said Margaret my Wife,
that the foresaid Manners of Herdwyk and Grafton with the avowson of the
Church of Grafton with all the appurtenances, and with all the said Londs and
Tenements with the Rents and appurtenances in Irtlingburgh, remain to Rauf
Green my Son, and to his Heirs of his body coming, be sufficient and sure
Estate to him by my said Feoffes to be made; and for default of issue of the
body of the said Rauf, the remainder to my right heirs in tail. Also I will
that anon after the decease of the said Margaret, that the foresaid Manners of
Grateley and Matherne with the avowson and appurtenances remain to Herry Green
my Son and to the heirs of his body begotten; and for default of issue of the
body of the said Herry, the remainder to my right heirs in tail. And in case
that anon after the decease of the said Margaret, if the said Herry my Son
desire rather to have the said Manner of Herdwyk than the said Manner of
Grateley, I will that then the said Herry have the said Manner of Herdwyk to
him and to his heirs of his body begotten; and for default of issue of the said
Herry, the remainder to my right heirs in tail be sufficient estate by the said
Feoffes to him to be made. Also I will that then the said Rauf my Son have the
said Manner of Grateley with the avowson and appurtenances to him and to his
heirs in tail; and for default of issue of his body, the remainder to my right
heirs intail be sure and sufficient Estate to him be my said Feoffes to be
made. Also I will that there be rered and sold out of my Woods of Herdwyk and
Grafton to the value of the sum of two hundred pounds to the marriages of
Margery and Isabell my Daughters, even to be departed between them; and if the
tone dye not married, then the the other to have the whole sum of two hundred
pounds, so that they will be married by the counseil and ordinance of the said
Margaret my Wife, Thomas Wydevyll, William Tresham, Walter Green and William
Aldwyncle. Also I will that Margaret my Wife, Thomas Wydevill, William Tresham,
Walter Green and William Aldwyncle have the governance, ordinance and
oversight of the sale of the said woods for the said sum to be rered. And
after that sum so rered, I will that the said Magaret my Wife have all the
remainant of the said woods to her awn use, to fell it down, and do therewith
what she will, without peachment of waste. Also I will that the said Margaret
have the keeping, cost and charge of my said Daughters till time that they be
married. Also I will that the said Margaret my Wife have her Dowry of all my
Manners, Londs, Tenements and Rents, with all the appurtenances in Wiltshire.
Moreover in case that my Sister my Lady Felbrigg dye, mine heir being within
age, I will that then William Aldwyncle and William Marshall Clerk, Feoffes of
the Manners, Londs and Tenements, with appurtenances that shall fall to me and
to mine heirs, after the decease of my said Lady Felbrigg, do rere and gather
up yearly, all the Rents and profits coming of the said Manners, Londs and
Tenements to the marriages of my said Daughters, till the time that mine heir
be of age. And furthermore I charge mine heir by my blessing, that he let none
this Will to be performed, nor be not against it, in no manner or wise. And if
mine heir will let this Will or do the contrary there against, in any manner or
degree, I will that then my said Feoffes hold and keep, in their own hands and
possession, all the said Manners, Londs, Tenements and Rents with all the
appurtenances, to dispose them for my soul, and for the souls of my auncesters,
after their discretions. And moreover I will that Margaret my Wife have all my
goods moveable and unmovable to her own profit and disposition at her own list.

HENRY GREEN, third of that name, Lord of Drayton and other Lands and
Lordships.
Doctor Fuller's History of the Worthies of England, Page 296.
HENRY Green of Drayton, who gave for his Arms, Argent a Cross Engrailed
Gules, was High Sheriff of the County of Northampton in the twenty third of
Henry VI. and again in the fourth year of Edward IV.

Carta Henrici Green.
OMnibus Christi fidelibus ad quos praesens Scriptum indentatum pervenerit,
Henricus Green Armiger, Willielmus Aldwyncle and Galfridus de Sancto Germano
de Broughton
Salutem.
Cum Domina Katherina Felbrigg nuper uxor Radulphi Green de Drayton in Comitatu
Northamptoniae Armigeri, Willielmus Yelverton unus Justiciarius Domini Regis,
Nicolaus Appylyerd and Johannes Dam habeant and teneant Maneria de Buckworth in
Comitatu Huntingtoniae, Manerium de Emberton in Comitatu Cantabrigiae, Manerium
de Alba Rothyng in Comitatu Essexiae, Maneria de Chalton and Culworth cum
redditibus in Farendysh in Comitatu Bedfordiae, Manerium de Wabenden vocatum
Greenes Manner, Manerium de Wolfton and Manerium de Emberton in Comitatu
Buckinghamiae cum pertinentiis ad terminum vitae dictae Katherinae, Reversione
inde Nobis praefatis Henrico, Willielmo Aldwyncle and Galfrido spectante:
Noveritis nos praefatos Henricum, Willielmum Aldwyncle and Galfridum statum and
possessionem praedictae Dominae Katherinae, Willielmi Yelverton, Nicolai and
Johannis Dam de and in omnibus and singulis Maneriis supradictis cum
pertinentiis ratificasse, approbasse and tenore praesentium confirmasse:
Habenda and tenenda eadem Maneria cum omnibus and singulis eorum pertinentiis
praefatis Dominae Katherinae, Willielmo Yelverton, Nicolao and Johanni Dam ad
terminum vitae dictae Katherinae. Et ulterius concessimus pro Nobis and
haeredibus nostris praedictae Dominae Katherinae, Willielmo Yelverton, Nicolao
and Johanni Dam quod pro aliquo vasto in aliquo Manerio Maneriorum praedictorum
faciendo usque ad summam quadraginta solidorum de caetero non impetantur,
graventur nec molestentur. Et insuper noveritis Nos praefatum Henricum,
Willielmum Aldwyncle and Galfridum concessisse antedictis Dominae Katherinae,
Willielmo Yelverton, Nicolao and Johanni quod been licebit eisdem Dominae
Katherinae, Willielmo Yelverton, Nicolao and Johanni durante vita dictae
Katherinae prostituere maeremium ad reparandum Maneria praedicta and tenementa
eisdem Maneriis pertinentia; Necnon subboscum, Wrangles and Sheredelbode pro
clausuris in Maneriis praedictis fiendis, and pro focali suo ibidem ardendo
prostituere and succidere absque impetitione vasti inde per Nos vel haeredes
nostros vel per aliquos nostrum versus ipsam Dominam Katherinam, Willielmum
Yelverton, Nicolaum and Johannem prosequenda. Ac insuper Noveritis Nos
praefatum Henricum, Willielmum Aldwyncle and Galfridum remisisse, relaxasse and
omnino pro Nobis and haeredibus nostris imperpetuum quietum clamasse praefatis
Dominae Katherinae, Willielmo Yelverton, Nicolao and Johanni omnimodas actiones
reales and personales ratione alicujus vasti ante datum praesentium facti, quas
versus ipsos Dominam Katherinam, Willielmum Yelverton, Nicolaum and Johannem
unquam habuimus, habemus seu quovismodo habere poterimus in futurum a principio
mundi usque in diem Confectionis praesentium. In cujus rei testimonium uni
parti hujus Scripti indentati penes praefatam Dominam Katherinam, Willielmum
Yelverton, Nicolaum and Johannem remanenti, Nos praedicti Henricus, Willielmus
Aldwyncle and Galfridus Sigilla nostra apposuimus; Alteri vero parti ejusdem
Scripti indentati penes Nos residenti dicta Domina Katherina, Willielmus
Yelverton, Nicolaus and Johannes Dam Sigilla sua apposuerunt.

Dat' septimo die Maii, Anno Regni Regis Henrici Sexti post Conquestum
tricesimo primo. Froddesham.

Carta Henrici Green.
TO all manner of men to whom this Writing may come, be it known, where before
this time that William Aldwincle Esquire has enfeffed Master Walter Dove and
other in two Assartes called Langhill and Ferthingeshaw in the County of
Northampton to the use of the same William, to have and to hold to them and to
their heirs for evermore; And now on late time the said Master Walter and other
Feffees of the said William by the desire and agreement of the same William
have made a state of the said two Assartes to William Lord Lovell Knight and
other to the use of Henry Green Esquire, to have and to hold, to them and to
their heirs for evermore: Also that where before this time that the same Henry
has enfeffed the said William Aldwyncle in his Manner of Luffwick, with all
his other Lands, Tenements and their appurtenances in Luffwyck, to have and to
hold them to him for term of his life, the remainder of them to William Lucy
Knight and others, to them and to their heirs for evermore, to the use of the
said Henry; And afterward the said William Aldwyncle, at the desire of the said
Henry, surrendered all his Estate and released all right and claim that he had
in the same Manner, Lands and Tenements with their appurtenances to the said
William Lucy and other Feffees to the said Henry: Nevertheless, I the said
Henry grant to the said William Aldwyncle the said two Assartes for term of his
life without impeachment of any waste, and the said Manner, Lands and Tenements
with their appurtenances for term of his life; and over that I pray and require
as well my said Feffees that now be in the said Manner, Lands, Tenements and
Assartes, and over each of them as any other that shall be hereafter to the use
of me or my heirs, to make a state to the said William Aldwyncle in the said
Manner, Lands, Tenements and Assartes with their appurtenance for the term of
his life in the form abovesaid at such time reasonable as he shall desire of
them so to do. In witness hereof I the same Henry set to the Seal of my Arms.

Given the tenth day of October the year of King Henry the VI. after the
Conquest the three and thirtieth.
Carta Regis Henrici Sexti.
HEnricus Dei gratia Rex Angliae and Franciae and Dominus Hiberniae,
omnibus Ballivis and fidelibus suis ad quos praesentes Literae pervenerint
Salutem.
Sciatis quod de gratia Nostra speciali and ex certa scientia and mero motu
nostris pardonavimus, remisimus and relaxavimus Henrico Green Armigero, alias
dicto Henrico Green Armigero filio and haeredi Johannis Green, alias dicto
Henrico Green Armigero Consanguineo and haeredi Radulphi Green, alias dicto
Henrico Green nuper Vicecomiti Northamptoniae, seu quocunque alio nomine
censeatur, omnimodas transgressiones, offensas, misprisiones, contemptus and
impetitiones per ipsum Henricum ante nonum diem Julii ultimo praeteritum contra
formam statutorum de libertatibus pannorum and capitiorum factos sive
perpetratos unde punitio caderet in demandam, debitum, seu in finem,
redemptionem, aut in alias poenas pecuniarias, seu imprisonamenta, statutis
praedictis non obstantibus. Et insuper ex motu and scientia nostris praedictis
pardonavimus, remisimus and relaxavimus eidem Henrico sectam pacis, nostrae
quae ad Nos versus ipsum pertinet pro omnimodis proditionibus, murdris,
raptibus mulierum, rebellionibus, insurrectionibus, feloniis, conspirationibus,
Cambipartiis, manutenentiis and imbraciariis, ac aliis transgressionibus,
negligentiis, offensis, extortionibus, misprisionibus, ignorantiis,
contemptibus, concelamentis, forisfacturis and deceptionibus per ipsum Henricum
ante dictum nonum diem Julii qualitercunque factis sive perpetratis, ac etiam
Utlagarias si quae in ipsum Henricum hiis occasionibus seu earum aliqua fuerint
promulgatae, and firmam pacem nostram ei inde concedimus: Ita tamen quod stet
rectus in Curia nostra si qui versus eum loqui voluerint de praemissis vel
aliquo praemissorum. Et ulterius pardonavimus, remisimus and relaxavimus eidem
Henrico omnimoda Escapia felonum, Catalla felonum and fugitivorum, Catalla
Utlagatorum and felonum de se, deodanda, vasta, impetitiones ac omnimodos
articulos itineris, destructiones and transgressiones de viridi vel venatione,
venditiones boscorum infra forestas and extra, and aliarum rerum quarumcunque
ante dictum nonum diem Julii infra Regnum nostrum Angliae and Marchias Walliae
eventa and evenientia, Unde punitio caderet in demandam, debitum, seu in finem
and redemptionem aut in alias poenas pecuniarias, seu in forisfacturas bonorum
and catallorum, aut imprisonamenta seu amerciamenta Comitatuum villarum vel
singularium personarum, vel in onerationem liberi tenementi eorum qui nunquam
transgressi fuerunt, ut haeredum, executorum vel terrae tenentium, Escaetorum,
Vicecomitum, Coronatorum and aliorum hujusmodi, and omne id quod ad Nos versus
ipsum Henricum pertinet seu pertinere poterit ex causis supradictis. Ac etiam
pardonavimus, remisimus and relaxavimus eidem Henrico omnimodas donationes,
alienationes and perquisitiones per ipsum de terris and tenementis de Nobis vel
progenitoribus nostris quondam Regibus Angliae in Capite tentis, ac etiam
omnimodas donationes and perquisitiones ad manum mortuam factas and habitas
absque licentia Regia, Necnon omnimodas inquisitiones and ingressus in
haereditatem suam in part vel in toto post mortem Antecessorum suorum absque
debita prosecutione ejusdem extra manum regiam ante eundem nonum diem Julii
factos, una cum exitibus and proficuis inde medio tempore perceptis. Et insuper
pardonavimus, remisimus and relaxavimus eidem Henrico omnimodas poenas ante
dictum nonum diem Julii forisfactas coram Nobis seu Concilio nostro,
Cancellario, Thesaurario seu aliquo Judicum nostrorum pro aliqua causa, and
omnes alias poenas tam Nobis quam carissimo nostro Patri defuncto per ipsum
Henricum pro aliqua causa ante eundum nonum diem Julii forisfactas, and ad opus
nostrum levandas, ac omnimodas securitates pacis ante eundem nonum diem Julii
similiter forisfactas, ac etiam tertias and tertiarum tertias omnimodorum
prisonariorum in guerra captorum Nobis dicto nono die Julii qualitercunque
debitas, pertinentes seu spectantes per eundem Henricum; Necnon omnimodas
transgressiones, offensas, misprisiones, contemptus and impetitiones per ipsum
Henricum ante eundem nonum diem Julii contra formam tam quorumcunque
statutorum, ordinationum and provisionum ante dictum nonum diem Julii factorum
seu editorum de perquisitionibus, acceptationibus, lectionibus,
publicationibus, notificationibus and executionibus quibuscunque, quarumcunque
literarum and bullarum Apostolicarum ante dictum nonum diem Julii and omnium
aliorum statutorum, ordinationum and provisionum, praetextu quorum aliqua secta
versus eundem Henricum per billam vel per breve de praemunire facta seu alio
modo quocunque pro aliqua materia ante eundem nonum diem Julii fieri valeat,
quam quorumcunque aliorum statutorum fact' sive perpetrat', statutis,
ordinationibus and provisionibus illis non obstantibus, literis and bullis de
exemptionibus duntaxat exceptis. Ac etiam pardonavimus, remisimus and
relaxavimus eidem Henrico omnimodos fines adjudicatos, amerciamenta, exitus
forisfactos, relevia, scutagia, ac omnimoda debita, compota praestita and
arreragia firmarum and compotorum Nobis ante octavum diem Julii Anno Regni
nostri vicesimo sexto qualitercunque debita and pertinentia; Necnon omnimodas
actiones and demandas quas Nos solus vel Nos conjunctim cum aliis personis vel
alia persona habemus seu habere poterimus versus ipsum Henricum pro aliquibus
hujusmodi finibus, amerciamentis, exitibus, releviis, scutagiis, debitis,
compotis praestitis and arreragiis ante eundem octavum diem Julii Nobis
debitis, ac etiam Utlagariis in ipsum Henricum promulgatis pro aliqua causarum
supradictarum, omnimodis debitis and compotis Nobis debitis and pertinentibus
quae vigore literarum nostrarum Patentium seu brevium nostrorum de magno vel
privato Sigillo aut per estallamenta sive assignationes respectuata existunt
omnino exceptis. Et quod praesens pardonatio nostra quoad praemissa seu aliquod
praemissorum non cedat in dampnum, praejudicium vel derogationem alicujus
alterius personae quam personae nostrae duntaxat, nec quod praesens pardonatio
nostra nec aliqua hujusmodi pardonatio nostra ad aliquos magnos computantes
nostros qui nunc sunt vel qui nuper fuerunt, videlicet ad Thesaurarium Cales
and Hospitii nostri, Vitellarios Cales, Camerarios Cestriae, North Walliae and
South Walliae, Custodes Gardrobae, Hospitii nostri aut Custodes magnae
Gardrobae nostrae, aut Custodes sive Clericos operationum nostrarum,
Constabularios, Burdegales, Thesaurarium terrae nostrae Hiberniae, and
receptores Ducatus nostri Lancastriae and Ducatus nostri Cornubiae tam
generales quam particulares quo ad aliqua hujusmodi officia sua seu hujusmodi
occupationes suas aut alicujus earundem tangentia ullo modo se extendat. In
cujus rei testimonium has Literas nostras fieri fecimus Patentes.

Test meipso apud Westmonasterium quarto decimo die Octobris Anno Regni nostri
tricesimo quarto. Kirkeham.
Per ipsum Regem.



Indentura inter Ducem Buckinghamiae and Henricum Green pro maritagia
Constanciae filiae praedicti Henrici.
THIS Indenture made the nineteenth day of January in the year of the Reign of
King Henry the Sixth, after the Conquest the six and thirtieth, between the
high and mighty Prince Humfrey Duc of Buks on that oon party and Henry Green
Squire on that other party Witnesses, That it is accorded and agreed between
the said parties in the form that follows, that is, to wite, That John, oon
of the Sons of the said Duc, shall by the grace of God wedde and take to wife
Constance Daughter and heir apparent to the said Henry Green; before the fest
of Lammasse next coming, and the said Constance shall take to Husband the said
John before the same fest, and the said Duc shall bear all the costs of the
same Marriage. And the said Duc grants by these presents for the said marriage
to be had in the form aforesaid, that he shall make, or do to be made before
the fest of the Nativite of Saint John Baptiste next coming to William Katesby
Knight, Henry Green, Squire, Thomas Littilton, Thomas Bylling Serjaunts of
Law, Thomas Wake Squire, Robert Tanfeld and William Cumberford, a sufficient
and lawful Estate in and of Manoirs, Londs and Tenements, to the yearly value
of four hundred marks over all manner, charges, and repryses, the ordinary
charges of ordinary officers only except, to have to theyme and to their
heirs for evermore. And the said Duc and my Lady his wife shall before the said
fest of Saint John, by Fine to be rered in the Kings Court, at the costs of
the said Duc between theyme and the said William Catesby, Henry Green, Thomas
Littilton, Thomas Billyng, Thomas Wake, Robert Tanfeld and William Cumberford
beying seized of the same Manoirs, Londs and Tenements before the said
feoffament made to theyme, knowlage the same Monoirs, Londs and Tenements to be
the right of the said William Catesby, as tho that the same William, Henry,
Thomas, Thomas, Thomas, Robert and William have of the yeft of the said Duc and
my Lady his wife: And the same Duc, and my Lady, and the heirs of my said Lady,
shall warant the said Manoirs, Londs and Tenements to the said William, Henry,
Thomas, Thomas, Thomas, Robert and William and to the heirs of the said Willam
Catesby for evermore.

Item, The said Duc shall do and cause Humfrey his son and heir apparaunt
by his deed sufficient in Law enrolled in the Kings Court of Record to ratefye
and confirm the state of the said William Catesby, Henry Green, Thomas
Littilton, Thomas Billyng, Thomas Wake, Robert Tanfeld and William Cumberford,
and to the heirs of oon of theyme according to the said fine of and in the
Londs and Tenements comprised in the same fine, with a clause of Warantie
according to the same.

Item, The said William Catesby, Henry Green, Thomas Littilton, Thomas
Billyng, Thomas Wake, Robert Tanfeld and William Cumberford so being seized of
the said Manoirs, Londs and Tenements shall grant sufficiently by their deed
to such persons as the said Henry Green shall name, an annuyte of three
hundred marks goying out of all the said Londs and Tenements to be perceyved
for term of the lyfes of Margaret wife to the said Henry, John and Constance
and everyche of theyme longest lyvyng, the same annuyte to begin to be
levable at such times as the same John and Constance, or outher of theyme, or
any outher by the sturringe, excitation, or commandemente of theyme, or of
outher of theyme during the life of the said John, or else the said Constance
after the decesse of the said John being not relyvered to her said Fader as is
hereafter written, disturb, or interrupte in any wise, after the death of the
said Henry, the Estates made or to be made by the said Henry, or by other at
his desire, to the said Margaret his wife, or to other his servants, for term
of their lyfes of three hundred marks worth land by year, beneth excepted, or
any part thereof, or else disturb or interrupte the last will of the said
Henry to be made by hyme of Londs by hyme purchased, or to be purchased, or of
his movable goods; and if noe such disturbance or interruption be, the said
grant to be void.

Item, The said William Catesby, Henry Green, Thomas Littilton, Thomas
Billyng, Thomas Wake, Robert Tanfeld and William Cumberford so being seized of
the said Manoirs, Londs and Tenements after the said grant of Annuyte and
within three months after the said marriage had, shall make Estate by deed
endented of all the said Manoirs, Londs and Tenements to the said Duc, to have
to him for term of his life, without impechment of waste; the remayndre
thereof after his decesse to the said John and Constance, and to the heirs of
their two bodies begotyn, the remayndre thereof, for defaute of such heirs,
to the right heirs of the said Duc.

Item, Hit is agreed and accorded between the said parties, that the said Duc
and my Lady his wife, shall have the rule and governaunce of the said Constance
after the said marriage had, duringe the spousel between the said John and
Constance, and find her at the costs of the same Duc.

Item, The said Henry grants by these Presents, that the said Constance his
Daughter, shall have after his decesse, and after the decesse of such person
or persons as now has, or by the said Henry, or by his Feoffees at his desire
shall have, any Londs or Tenements for term of life, whereof the reversion is
or shall be to the same Henry, or to any other to his use, all the issues and
profits of all the Londs and Tenements that he, or any to his use, has without
diminution or abregement; and the Feoffees in and of the same Londs and
Tenements that now be, or shall be, shall within six months after the death
of the same Henry, make thereof Estate to the said Constance, and to her heirs
if they be thereto required, except that it shall be lawful to the said Henry
to grant, or do to be granted, to Margaret his wife, and to other his
servants, Londs and Tenements of the same to the yearly value of three hundred
marks, to have to theyme only for term of life of theyme that the said
Grauntes shall be made unto, so that the reversion thereof, after the decesse
of the said Henry, and of such persons as the said Grauntes shall be made
unto, shall come to the said Constance and to her heirs; Except also that hit
shall be lawful to the said Henry for to do and aleyne at his will and
pleasure, all such Londs and Tenements as he has purchased before this time,
now being in his hands, or in any other man's to his use; and also all such
Londs and Tenements as he shall purchase hereafter, not being at this day in
his own hands, nor in none other persons to his use; Except also other Londs
and Tenements to the yearly value of two hundred marks, whereof the Feoffees of
the said Henry that now been, or shall be after the decesse of the said Henry,
shall suffer the said John and Constance to take the profits unto the time that
the same John and Constance, or outher of theyme, or any other by their
excitation, sturryng or commandment, let, disturb or interrupte, in any
wise, the Estates made or to be made by the said Henry, or by any other at his
desire to the said Margaret his wife, or to other his servaunts for term of
their lyfes, of the said three hundred marks worth Land above except, or any
part thereof, or else disturb or interrupte the last will of the said Henry
to be made by him of the said Londs by him purchased, or to be purchased, or of
his moveable goods; and if any such disturbaunce or interruption be, then the
said Feoffees shall restreyne the said John and Constance of taking of any
profits of the said two hundred marks worth Land, and shall apply the
profits thereof for the soul hele of the said Henry, or else for
perfourmynge of such will as the said Henry shall thereof declare.

For seen always, that if the said Henry happen hereafter to have any other
issue by the said Margaret his wife, that then all his said Londs and
Tenements, except thereof one hundred pounds worth land by year, and except the
said Londs and Tenements purchased and to be purchased after the form
aforesaid, shall descend or come to such as the Common Law will shall be heir
to the said Henry of the body of the said Margaret begotyn. And the said Henry
grants that if hit happen him hereafter to have issue male by the said
Margaret his wife, that notwithstondyng the said Constance shall have to her
and to her heirs after the death of the said Henry one hundred pounds worth
Londs above except of the said Londs and Tenements. And if hit happen hereafter
the said Henry to have other issue female by the said Margaret, and dye
without issue male begotyn of the body of the same Margaret, then the said
Constance shall have, after the death of the same Henry, one hundred pounds
worth Land by year of the said Londs and Tenements, over such part as should
come to her by the death of the said Henry her Fader, after the course of the
Common Law, and the same Henry shall not hereafter make any will to the
contrary of the premises.

Item, The said Henry grants that he shall be bounden to the said Duc by his
obligation to be enrolled in the Kings Court, at the costs of the said Duc,
in two thousand marks, upon condition to be contained in the same obligation,
that he shall not alien, ne discontynue, ne make to be aliened or discontynued
any Londs or Tenements, which he or any other person or persons to his use
has in demene or reversion, otherwise than is abovesaid, but if hit be to the
entente abovesaid, ne any thing else do or cause to be done touching the said
Londs and Tenements, that shall be in derogation or prejudice of the premises,
or contrary to the entente abovesaid.

Item, The said Duc grants by these presents, that if hit happen hereafter
(as God defend) the said John his Son to dye after the said marriage had
lyvyng the said Duc and Constance, then the said Duc within two months after
the decesse of the said John, shall delyver or do to be delyvered to the said
Henry, or to his Executours, at Milton in the Shire of Northampton, at the
costs of the said Henry or of his Executours, the said Constance unmaried and
unassured of marriage to any other person by the sturryng, procuring, will or
assent of the said Duc; and the same Duc shall do his part for to let the
said Constance to be married, or assured of marriage, to any other person
before the said livere of her made to the said Henry or to his Executours.

Item, The said Duc grants that he shall deliver within a half year after
the said marriage to the said Henry to the use of the said John and Constance,
all the Evidences that the same Duc or any other to his behof has concerning
only the said Londs and Tenements, whereof the same Duc shall make or do to
be made a state to the said William Catesby, Henry Green, Thomas, Thomas,
Thomas, Robert and William Cumberford as is abovesaid; and if any Evidences
there be concerning to the same Londs and Tenements, or any part of theyme and
other Londs and Tenements, that then the said Henry shall have the
Exemplification of theyme at the costs of the said Duc if the said Henry
desire them.

In witness whereof to that one part of these Endentures with the said Duc
remaining the foresaid Henry Green has set his Seall, and to that other
part of the same Endentures with the said Henry remaining, the said Duc has
set his Seall. Yeven the day and year abovesaid.
Ultima Voluntas Henrici Green.
THIS is the Will of me Henry Green Squire, made the third day of September,
the seventh year of the Reign of King Edward the Fourth, upon the Manner of
Sudburgh and all the Londs and Tenements with their appurtenances that been of
my purchase in Sudburgh aforesaid in the Count of Northampton, Thorpe, beside
Petirburgh, Marham, Wittelsey, Southorp and Luffwyck, and of the woods called
Langhyll and Ferthyngshaw in the same Count, and of all other woods wh^che I
bought of William Aldwyncle, and in the hands of diverse persons by Testemen^
made to theyme for mine use, as it appears in several deeds to perform my
will.

Whereupon first I will that my Feoffes of and in my Londs and Tenements in
Thorpe, beside Petirburgh after my decesse make estate of theyme to Margaret my
wife for term of her lyve, the remaindre thereof to Constance my Daughter, to
have to her and to the heirs of her body begotyn, and for defaute of such
issue the remaindre thereof to my right heirs.

Item, I will that my Feoffes of the Londs and Tenements in Wittelsey, Southorp
and Marham of my purchase after my decesse make estate of them to Margaret my
wife for term of her life, the remaindre thereof to Robert Wittelbury and to
the heirs of his body begotyn, and for defaute of such issue the remaindre
thereof to my right heirs.

And I will that my Feoffes of the Londs and Tenements in Luffwyk of my
purchase called Coals, Thing and Befviles Thing after my decesse, make estate
to my Lord John of Buckingham, and to my Lady his wife, and to the heirs
coming betwix theyme, and for defaute of such issue the remaindre thereof to
my right heirs for ever, if my said Lord nor Lady, nor their heirs, nor any
other by theyme procuryng, assentyng, or commandment in any part hereof let
not my will to be performyd, and if they or any of theyme let my said will to
be performyd, then I will that their estate thereyn be void, and that the same
Londs and Tenements be sold and disposed by mine Executours in deeds of Charity.

Item, I will that two Priests shall be made sure, either of them to have
fourtene marks yearly on the charges of my purchased Londs or Rentes,
perpetually to sing in the Parysh Church of Luffwyk, and to do other devyne
service there and pray for the sowles of me and of Sir Henry Green Justice,
and other of mine Auncestres and Benefactors, and all Crystyn sowles. And if
hit shall happyn no such xxiiij marks yearly to be purchesid hereafter be me,
then I will they shall have sewerly to theyme and their successors for
evermore xxiiij marks yearly perpetuelly of my Manner of Sudburgh.

Item, I will that Thomas Haldenby shall have a sufficiant grant of one
annuite of xiiij marks to have to him for term of his life, to be taken of the
revenue of my Manner of Houghton in the Count of Northampton, if he make his
Lettres Patents that he has of like grant by me made to him, to be taken of
the Manners of Hardewyk and Grateley to be surrendid and cancellid, and he to
do like service as is contenyd in his said first Lettres Patentes.

Item, I will that Margaret my wife, after my decesse, have the Maneres of
Buckworth in the Count of Huntyngton, and Herdewyk in the Count of
Northampton with other Londs and Tenements before expressed for term of her
lyve, the remayndre of theyme to my right heirs.

Item, I will that my Feoffees of my Woods and Assartes called Langhill, and
Farthingshaw, and Tolkithorpewoode, after my decesse make a state of my said
Lord John and Dame Constance his wife, my Daughter, and to the heirs of the
body of the same Dame Constance coming, and for defaute of such issue, the
remayndre of theyme to the right heirs of me the said Henry Green.

In witness whereof to these Presents I set the Seal of mine Arms. Yeven the
day and year abovesaid. seal of Sir Henry Green SIGILLVM HENRICI GRENE
ARMIGIRI



Carta Margaretae Relictae Henrici Green.
NOverint Universi per Praesentes me Margaretam quae sui uxor Henrici Green
Armigeri defuncti fecisse, ordinasse and loco meo posuisse Dilectos mihi in
Christo Robertum Wittelbury Armigerum and Jacobum Barlowe meos veros and
legitimos Attornatos conjunctim and divisim ad recipiendum pro me and nomine
meo de Thoma Lenton and Katherina filia Roberti Long consanguinea and haerede
Willielmi Aldwyncle Armigeri defuncti, vel de eorum in hac part Attornatis,
plenam and pacificam possessionem and seisinam de and in Manerio de Comberton
cum suis pertinentiis in Comitatu Cantabrigiae secundum vim, formam and
effectum cujusdam Cartae indentatae per praefatum Thomam and Katherinam mihi
prefatae Margaretae ad terminum vitae meae inde confectae, Ratum and gratum
habens and habitura totum and quicquid praedicti Attornati mei nomine meo
fecerint aut alter eorum fecerit in praemissis. In cujus rei Testimonium
Praesentibus Sigillum meum apposui.

Datum vicesimo sexto die mensis Maii Anno Regni Regis Edwardi Quarti post
Conquestum nono.
The Tomb of Henry Green Lord of Drayton Extant in St. Peter's Church in
Luffwick
tomb of Sir Henry and Constance (nee Poynings) Green
CONSTANCE GREEN, Countess of Wiltshire, Lady of Drayton and other Lands and
Lordships.
Antiquities of Warwickshire, Page 729. Writing of Maxton- Castle.
WITHIN the body thereof is a little Chapel, in which by special dispensation
of Reynold Boaters, then Bishop of this Diocese, was solemnized the Marriages
of John Talbot Earl of Shrewsbury and Katharine Stafford, one of the Daughters
of the said Duke, in the thirty sixth year of King Henry the Sixth; and of John
Stafford one of his younger Sons, after created Earl of Wiltshire, and
Constance the Daughter of Henry Green Esquire.

Baronage of England, Page 174. Stafford Earl of Wiltshire.
IN the ninth of Edward the Fourth, the fifth of January, John Stafford a
younger Son to Humphrey Duke of Buckingham was created Earl of Wiltshire, and
in the twelfth of Edward the Fourth joined in Commission with the Earl of
Northumberland and others, to treat with the Ambassadors of James the third
King of Scotland, upon certain complaints of grievances from each Realm. And
having married Constance the Daughter and heir of Sir Henry Green of Drayton
in the County of Northampton Knight, departed this life the eight of May, the
thirteenth of Edward the Fourth, leaving Edward his Son three years of age,
being then seized jointly with the said Constance of the Manors of Southo in
Com. Hunt. of Newinton-Blosmaville, Clifton and Pollicote in Comitatu Bucks, of
the Manors of Stamford, Rivers, Tracies, Suttons, Piggesland, Bottelles, and
Briggs, in Comitatu Essexiae; Effingham, Shepestead, Tillingdon, Porkley,
Waldingham, Upwoode, Gatyers and Fallingburg, in Comitatu Surriae.

Carta Regis Edwardi Quarti.
EDwardus Dei gratia Rex Angliae and Franciae and Dominus Hiberniae,
omnibus ad quos praesentes Literae pervenerint Salutem.
Sciatis quod de gratia nostra speciali and absque fine seu feodo Nobis in
Hanapario Cancellariae nostrae solvendo concessimus and licentiam dedimus pro
Nobis and haeredibus nostris quantum in Nobis est praedilecto Consanguino
nostro Johanni Stafford Militi, filio Humfridi nuper Ducis Buckinghamiae, and
Constanciae uxori ejusdem Johannis, filiae and haeredis Henrici Green Armigeri
defuncti, quod ipsi Manerium de Grafton juxta Gedyngton cum pertinentiis in
Comitatu Northamptoniae, and Manerium de Hardwyke cum pertinentiis in eodem
Comitatu, quae de Nobis tenentur in Capite, ut dicitur, dare possint and
concedere Richardo Heton, Willielmo Comberford, Johanni Jefferey Clerico, and
Olivero Sutton; Habendum and tenendum sibi and haeredibus suis de Nobis and
haeredibus nostris per servitia inde debita and consueta imperpetuum: Ita quod
ipsi habita inde plena and pacifica seisina dictum Manerium de Grafton juxta
Gedyngton cum pertinentiis dare possint and concedere praefatis Johanni
Stafford and Constanciae, Habendum and tenendum sibi and haeredibus ipsius
Constanciae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia praedicta
imperpetuum. Et dictum Manerium de Hardewike cum pertinentiis dare possint and
concedere Margaretae quae fuit uxor praedicti Henrici Green Armigeri, Habendum
and tenendum eidem Margaretae pro termino vitae suae de Nobis and haeredibus
nostris per servitia praedicta; Ita quod post mortem ejusdem Margaretae idem
Manerium de Hardewike cum pertinentiis integre remaneat praefato Johanni
Stafford and Constanciae; Habendum and tenendum sibi and haeredibus ipsius
Constanciae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia praedicta
imperpetuum. Ac etiam tam eisdem Richardo, Willielmo, Johanni Jefferey and
Olivero, quod ipsi Maneria praedicta cum pertinentiis a praefatis Johanne
Stafford and Constancia recipere possint and tenere sibi and haeredibus suis
praedictis de Nobis and haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia praedicta
imperpetuum, quam eisdem Johanni Stafford and Constanciae quod ipsi dictum
Manerium de Grafton juxta Gedyngton cum pertinentiis a praefatis Richardo,
Willielmo, Johanne, Jefferey and Olivero similiter recipere possint and tenere
sibi and haeredibus ipsius Constanciae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris
praedictis per servitia praedicta imperpetuum. Ac eidem Margaretae quod ipsa
dictum Manerium de Hardewicke cum pertinentiis a praefatis Richardo, Willielmo,
Johanne, Jefferey and Olivero recipere possit, and tenere sibi pro termino
vitae suae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia praedicta;
Ita quod post mortem ejusdem Margaretae idem Manerium de Hardewicke cum
pertinentiis integre remaneat praefatis Johanni Stafford and Constanciae,
Habendem and tenendum sibi and haeredibus ipsius Constanciae de Nobis and
haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia predicta sicut praedictum est,
imperpetuum, tenore praesentium similiter licentiam dedimus specialem. Nolentes
quod praefati Johannes Stafford and Constancia vel haeredes ipsius Constanciae,
aut praefati Richardus, Willielmus, Johannes Jefferey and Oliverus vel haeredes
sui, aut praefata Margareta per Nos vel haeredes nostros, Justiciarios,
Escaetores, Vicecomites, Coronatores aut alios Ballivos seu Ministros nostros
vel haeredum nostrorum quoscunque ratione praemissorum occasionentur,
molestentur, impetantur in aliquo seu graventur, aut eorum aliquis
occasionetur, molestetur, impetatur in aliquo seu gravetur. In cujus rei
Testimonium has Literas nostras fieri fecimus Patentes.

Test meipso apud Westmonasterium decimo octavo die Maii Anno Regni nostri
nono. Iver. Per breve de privato Sigillo and de data praedicta auctoritate
Parliamenti.

Carta Regis Edwardi Quarti.
EDwardus Dei gratia Rex Angliae and Franciae and Dominus Hiberniae,
Omnibus ad quos praesentes Literae pervenerint Salutem.
Sciatis quod de gratia nostra speciali and absque fine seu feodo Nobis in
Hanapario Cancellariae nostrae solvendo Concessimus and licentiam dedimus pro
Nobis and haeredibus nostris quantum in Nobis est, Thomae Lenton and Katherinae
filiae Roberti Long Consanguineis and haeredibus Willielmi Aldwyncle Armigeri
defuncti, quod ipsi Manerium de Alba Rothynge cum pertinentiis in Comitatu
Essexiae ac advocationem Ecclesiae de Alba Rothynge quae de Nobis tenetur in
Capite ut dicitur, dare possint and concedere praedilecto Consanguineo nostro
Johanni Stafford Militi, filio Humfridi nuper Ducis Buckinghamiae, and
Constanciae uxori ejusdem Johannis filiae and haeredi Henrici Green Armigeri
desuncti, Habendum and tenendum eisdem Johanni Stafford and Constanciae and
haeredibus ipsius Constanciae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris per servitia inde
debita and consueta imperpetuum. Et quod dicti Thomas and Katherina Manerium de
Comberton cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Cantabrigiae quod de Nobis similiter
tenetur in Capite ut dicitur, dare possint and concedere Margaretae quae fuit
uxor praedicti Henrici Green Armigeri, Habendum and tenendum eidem Margaretae
pro termino vitae suae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia
praedicta; Ita quod post mortem ejusdem Margaretae idem Manerium de Comberton
cum pertinentiis integre remaneat praefatis Johanni Stafford and Constanciae,
Habendum and tenendum sibi and haeredibus ipsius Constanciae de Nobis and
haeredibus nostris per servitia praedicta imperpetuum. Et tam eisdem Johanni
Stafford and Constanciae, quod ipsi dictum Manerium de Alba Rothynge cum
pertinentiis ac dictam advocationem Ecclesiae de Alba Rothynge a praedictis
Thoma and Katherina recipere possint and tenere sibi and haeredibus ipsius
Constanciae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia praedicta
imperpetuum, quam eidem Margaretae, quod ipsa dictum Manerium de Comberton cum
pertinentiis a praefatis Thoma and Katherina recipere possit and tenere sibi
pro termino vitae suae de Nobis and haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia
praedicta; Ita quod post mortem ejusdem Margaretae idem Manerium de Comberton
cum pertinentiis integre remaneat praefatis Johanni Stafford and Constanciae,
Habendum and tenendum sibi and haeredibus ipsius Constanciae de Nobis and
haeredibus nostris praedictis per servitia praedicta sicut praedictum est,
imperpetuum, tenore praesentium similiter licentiam dedimus specialem: Nolentes
quod praefati Thomas and Katherina vel haeredes sui, aut praefati Johannes
Stafford and Constancia vel haeredes ipsius Constanciae, aut praefata Margareta
per Nos vel haeredes nostros, Justiciarios, Escaetores, Vicecomites,
Coronatores aut alios Ballivos seu Ministros nostros quoscunque ratione
praemissorum occasionentur, molestentur, impetantur in aliquo seu, graventur,
aut eorum aliquis occasionetur, molestetur, impetatur in aliquo, seu gravetur.
In cujus rei testimonium has Literas nostras fieri fecimus Patentes.

Test meipso apud Westmonasterium decimo octavo die Maii Anno Regni nostri
nono. Iver. Per breve de privato Sigillo and de data praedicta auctoritate
Parliamenti.

Carta Thomae Lenton and Katherinae filiae Roberti Long.
SCiant praesentes and futuri quod Nos Thomas Lenton and Katherina filia
Roberti Long Consanguinea and haeres Willielmi Aldwyncle Armigeri defuncti, de
licentia Domini nostri Regis Edwardi Quarti per Literas suas Patentes concessa,
tradidimus, dimisimus and hac praesenti Carta nostra confirmavimus Johanni
Stafford Militi filio Humfridi nuper Ducis Buckinghamiae, and Constanciae uxori
ejusdem Johannis filiae and haeredis Henrici Green Armigeri defuncti, Manerium
de Alba Rothynge cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Essexiae ac advocationem
Ecclesiae de Alba Rothynge praedicta, Habendum and tenendum eisdem Johanni
Stafford and Constanciae and haeredibus ipsius Constanciae de dicto Domino Rege
and haeredibus suis per servitia inde debita and de jure consuera imperpetuum.
Fecimus etiam and constituimus dilectos Nobis in Christo Willielmum Warner and
Johannem Gissynge nostros veros and legitimos Attornatos conjunctim and divisim
ad deliberandum pro Nobis and nominibus nostris praefatis Johanni Stafford and
Constanciae vel eorum in hac part Attornato plenam and pacificam possessionem
and seisinam de and in Manerio ac advocatione praedictis cum suis pertinentiis
secundum vim, formam and effectum istius Cartae nostrae, Ratum and gratum
habentes and habituri totum and quicquid praedicti Attornati nostri fecerint
aut eorum alter fecerit in praemissis. In cujus rei Testimonium huic praesenti
Cartae nostrae Sigilla nostra apposuimus, Hiis Testibus, Thoma Tyrell,
Willielmo Tyrell seniore, Willielmo Tyrell juniore, Militibus; Waltero Writell
Armigero, and multis aliis.

Dat' vicesimo sexto die mensis Maii, Anno Regni Regis Edwardi Quarti
supradicti post Conquestum nono.
Ultima Voluntas Johannis Comitis Wilts
IN the name of God Amen. The one and twentyeth day of the month of April, the
year of our Lord God one thousand four hundred seaventy and three, I John Earl
of Wyltshyre, of holle mind and in good memory, bequeth my soul to Allmithi
Good my Creatur and Savior, to our Lady Saint Mary and to all the Holy Saints
in Heven, and my body to be beried in the Colage of Plassy, in the midell Arch.
And I will that mine Executors cause a convenient Tomb there to be made for me
of marble plain, with an image gilte like a Knight of the Garter thereupon,
with such Arms as I bear by mine Auncestres. Also I will that twelve marks of
the Manoir of Grimmisbry in the Count of Bedford be disposed unto a Pressed,
perpetually to sing for my soul within the said Colage of Plassy, chargyng on
Gods behalf, the Master there now being, or any other that hereafter shall
be, that they and ever ich of them chese allway a good and able Pressed to be
bounden to the service and customs of the same Colage as largely in all
things as any Fellow of the same been. Also I will that my servant Edward
Mandeby have forty shillings yearly during his life of the said Manoir of
Grimmesbry. And I will that my said Manoir the residue hereof yearly be
disposed to a poor man, to pray for me within the said Parish of Plassy. And
with the residue over that, if any be, I will yearly to be disposed for mine
obite. And also I will that the land I purchased of William Heton, the which
joyneth unto my Lordship of Newenton, remain unto my Son and heir, that it
be not put from the Lordship of Newenton, in recompense of the Lordship of
Gretwell in Lyncolnshire; and I have put in exchaunging for this, Lislode and
other. Also I will that all such plate as I had by wife, remain still again to
the use of her and my Son and hers. And as for the two gilte potis, six new
bollis gylte, two gylte basynnes that I bought, and a gylte cup being in the
kepeing of Oliver Sutton, with all other plate that is mine undisposed, be sold
to the most avayle, and with the money thereof coming my depts to be paid. And
I bequeth to my Sister of Shrewsbury two gilte Saltes that I bought. For all
such stuff as I bought my self, beding or any other thing, be at the
disposition of my Executors; so all that comen by my Fader-in-Law and my wife
remain still to the use of my said wife term of her life, and after to my
Son and heir. And I bequeth unto Berushaw my manne and servant, my long
black Gown furryed with blake lamb, and three pounds six shillings eight
pence in money; and I beseech my Lady my Mother to be his good Lady, and that
it will please her to take him to service. Also I bequeth unto the Parish
Church of Luffwyk an hole Gown of blake velvet. And I bequeth the Gowns of
silk unto the Colage of Plassy. Also bequeth my gray Coarser and Alisaunder my
henchman unto my Lord my Nevue. And as for my blake coarser I bequeath him unto
my Lady my Mother. And if it please the Kings good grace for all the true
service that ever I did him, I desire that my Lady my Mother may have the
keeping of my said Son, and I beseech the Kings good grace that my said
Son be never married under the estate of a Baron. Also I bequeth unto Thomas
Cheney the next bay coarser after my Lady my Mother have chosen. Also I will
pray William Merbury to be attendaunt unto my Son, and he to have rule about
him. Also I bequeth unto my Mother-in-law the cope that I had of my Sister
Veere. Also I bequeth unto Anne Wittelbury the cheyne of Gold that Cornish
has in pleage. Also I bequeth unto every Gentylman and Gentylwoman whit in my
howsehold five marks of money, and to every Yoman twenty shillings, to every
Groom thirteen shillinges four pence, and to every Page three shillings four
pence. Also I bequeth unto Bertelmew Chesnale my bay Geldynge. And I will that
all my detts which I owe to any person of right be duly and truly paid, of the
which I have put a great part to my knowlage in a bill hereunto annexid.
And if my detts may be paid of mine own goods by the mean of mine Executors
without the sale of my Manoir of Babenho, Then I will that the revenues and
profits of the said Manoir with the appurtenancas be left in the rule of mine
Executors to such time as my detts be paid; And that so done, I will that
the revenues and profits of the said Manoir with the appurtenaunces yearly
remain to the rule of my said Executors to the use and profit of my son and
heir during the time and space of his nonage; And than the said Manoir with
the appurtenaunces be delivered to my son and heir, and to the right heirs
of his body lawfully coming; And for lak of such issue to my Nevue Thomas
Talbot and to the heirs of his body lawfully coming; And for lak of such issue,
the remayner to my Lord, my Nevue of Buckingham, and to the right heirs of
him. And whereas any manner of dett or dute is owyng to me by obligation or
otherwise, with all such arrerages as be behind due to me of all my Lyflode or
possessions with all such issues and profits and revenues as is grown of
lyvelode of this Ester Term last paste, I will it be gadered and levied by
mine Executors to the performyng of my Will, and it for to be disposid for me
as theyme think it best. And the residue all my Goods and Catalles moveable,
wheresoever they be, after my Fynurell expenses and all costs and charges
performed and done, and all my bequstes within written well and trewly done and
fulfyllyd, I give then to the discretion of mine Executors to be done for me as
theyme seems best and most health of my soul. And of this my present Testament
I make and ordeyne mine Executors, that is to say, the most Reverent Fader in
God my Lord Cardenall, and my most interest beloved Lady and Mother my cheff
Executors; my Fader Walter, my Lord Mountjoy, the Master of the Colage of
Foderingham, Master John Geoffrey, Oliver Sutton, William Merbury and Rauf
Tykhull.

Indentura facta inter Constanciam Comitissam de Wilts and Thomam Billing
Capitalem Justiciar. Dom. Regis ad Placita, etc. and alios, facta.
HAEC Indentura facta inter Constanciam Comitissam Wilts ex part una and
Thomam Billing Capitalem Justiciarium Domini Regis ad Placita coram ipso Rege
tenenda, Richardum Tunstall Militem, Willielmum Catesby Militem, Johannem
Catesby Servientem Domini Regis ad legem, Nicolaum Griffen Armigerum, Robertum
Wittelbury Armigerum, Willielmum Catesby Armigerum, Thomam Merys Armigerum,
Richardum Welby, Thomam Babyngton, Oliverum Sutton and Simonem Burton ex part
altera testatur, Quod praefata Comitissa tradidit and ad firmam dimisit
praefatis Thomae, Richardo, Willielmo, Johanni, Nicolao, Roberto, Willielmo,
Thomae, Richardo, Thomae, Olivero and Simoni Manerium suum de Alba Rothynge cum
pertinentiis in Comitatu Essexiae una cum advocatione Ecclesiae ejusdem,
Manerium de Grafton juxta Warton cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Northamptoniae
una cum advocatione Ecclesiae ejusdem, Maneria de Warminster, Westbury and
Dycherigge cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Wilts, Habenda and tenenda praedicta
Maneria cum omnibus and singulis eorum pertinentiis una cum advocationibus
Ecclesiarum praedictarum praedictis Thomae, Richardo, Willielmo, Johanni,
Nicolao, Roberto, Willielmo, Thomae, Richardo, Thomae, Olivero and Simoni and
assignatis suis a festo Sancti Michaelis Archangeli ultimo praeterito ante
datum praesentium usque ad finem and terminum septem annorum extunc proxime
sequentium and plenarie completorum, Reddendo inde praefatae Comitissae vel
Assignatis suis centum and viginti libras legalis monetae Angliae annuatim
durante termino praedicto ad duos anni terminos, videlicet, ad festa Paschae
and Sancti Michaelis Archangeli per aequales portiones. Et si contingat dictam
annuam firmam centum and viginti librarum aretro fore in part vel in toto post
aliquod festum festorum praedictorum quo solvi debeat per sex septimanas, tunc
been liceat and licebit praedictae Comitissae and assignatis suis in omnibus
praedictis Maneriis cum omnibus and singulis eorum pertinentiis and in qualibet
parcella eorundem distringere and districtiones sic captas licite abducere,
effugare, asportare and penes se retinere quousque de praedicto annuali redditu
una cum arreragiis si quae fuerint, plenarie sibi fuerit satisfactum and
persolutum. In cujus rei Testimonium tam praefata Comitissa quam praefati
Thomas, Richardus, Willielmus, Johannes, Nicolaus, Robertus, Willielmus,
Thomas, Richardus, Thomas, Oliverus and Simon praesentibus Indenturis Sigilla
sua alternatim apponi fecerunt.

Dat' vicesimo die Martii Anno Regni Regis Edwardi Quarti post Conquestum
quarto decimo.
EDWARD STAFFORD Earl of Wiltshire, Lord of Drayton and other Lands and
Lordships.
Among the Evidences of the Earl of Peterborow.
MEmorandum, That in the sixth year of the Reign of our Sovereigne Lord King
Henry the Seventh, the Tennants and Inhabitants of Luffwycke and Sudburgh were
in variance, strife, and debate for the occupation of Luffwyke Leyse perteynyng
to Luffwycke, and for the occupation of Brigsyleyes perteyning to Sudburgh,
insomuch that the Tennants and Inhabitants of Luffwycke did impounde a flock of
Sheep of Sudburgh, sayeing, that they had noe Common of their Leyse: And in
like wise the Tennants and Inhabitants of Sudburgh did impounde a flock of
Sheep of Luffwycke, sayeing, that they had noe Common of their said
Brigsyleyes. And for as much as the Earl of Wiltes was chief Lord of both
the Lordships, the Inhabitants of both Towns sued to him and his Council for
reformation and pacefyeing of the said variance, strife, and debate. And when
he had heard their request, he said to them, that he would by the advice of his
Council take a good and an indifferent direction and order betwixt the said
parties. And then he commanded his Council to go to the said Leyes in
variance, and call before them the Inhabitants of both Towns, and view the
ground and set such directions betwixt the said Inhabitants of both Towns,
that there should be noe more variance for Common of the said Leyes after that
time. The which Councellers took a direction, that the Tennants of Luffwycke
should have and occupy their own Leyes in peace without disturbance or claim
of Common of the Tennants of Sudburgh; And in like wise the Tennants of
Sudburgh should have and occupy the said Brigsyleyes in peace without
disturbance or claim of Common of the Tennants of Luffwycke. And over that
they said, Ye been all my Lords Tennants, and it is his pleasure that ye
shall live in rest, as good neighbors should do. And after the said order and
direction it have been used and kept from the said sixth year till Midsommer
now last past.

Carta Edwardi Comitis Wilts.
SCiant praesentes and futuri quod Ego Edwardus Comes Wilts dedi and concessi
and hac praesenti Carta mea confirmavi Roberto Wittelbury Armigero, Willielmo
Marbury Armigero, Willielmo Field Clerico, Roberto Bayston Clerico, Thomae
Montegu and Johanni Freeman Maneria mea de Nauseby Church, Brampton, Houghton
magna, Hakelton, Pedyngton, Luffwyck, Islip, Sudburgh, Lenden, Haringworth,
Raundes, Stanwycke, Ringstede, Aldwyncle cum pertinentiis in Comitatu
Northamptoniae, Southo cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Huntingtoniae, Neuton,
Blosmevile, Clyfton, Reins, Policote, Wanden, Emberton, Wolston magna cum
pertinentiis in Comitatu Buckinghamiae, Grimmesbury, Bakenho, Chalton cum
pertinentiis in Comitatu Bedfordiae, Suttons, Piggeslonde, Bryggelonde,
Tracyes, Stamford Ryvers cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Essexiae, Chypstede,
Waldingham, Effingham cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Surriae, Warminstre,
Westbury, Grateley, Dychirche cum pertinentiis in Comitatu Wiltoniae, cum
advocationibus Ecclesiarum, Capellarum and Cantariarum eisdem Maneriis and
eorum cuilibet pertinentibus; ac etiam omnia alia terras and tenementa,
redditus, reversiones and proficua, advocationes Ecclesiarum and haereditamenta
quaecunque cum pertinentiis in Comitatibus praedictis quae nuper fuerunt
Johannis nuper Comitis Wilts sive Constanciae nuper uxoris ipsius Comitis, vel
aliquorum aliorum ad eorum sive eorum alterius usum in Comitatibus praedictis,
ac omnia terras, and tenementa mea in Comitatibus praedictis; Exceptis omnibus
illis terris and tenementis in eisdem Comitatibus cum pertinentiis quae de
Domino Rege immediate tenentur in Capite: Habenda and tenenda omnia praedicta
Maneria, terras and tenementa, redditus, reversiones and proficua cum omnibus
suis pertinentiis in Comitatibus praedictis (exceptis praeexceptis) praefato
Roberto Wittelbury, Willielmo Field, Roberto Bayston, Thomae Montegu and
Johanni Freeman, haeredibus and assignatis suis imperpetuum ad usum mei
praefati Comitis and haeredum meorum de Capitalibus Dominis feodi illius per
servitia inde debita and de jure consueta. Et Ego vero praedictus Comes and
haeredes mei omnia praedicta Maneria, terras and tenementa, redditus,
reversiones and proficua cum omnibus pertinentiis suis, advocationes
Ecclesiarum and haereditamenta supradicta cum omnibus suis pertinentiis,
exceptis praeexceptis, praefatis Roberto Wittelbury, Willielmo Marbury,
Willielmo Field, Robert Bayston, Thomae Montegu and Johanni Freeman, haeredibus
and assignatis suis contra omnes gentes warrantizabimus, acquietabimus and
imperpetuum defendemus. Noveritis insuper Nos praefatum Comitem ordinasse,
constituisse, attornasse, and in loco meo posuisse dilectum mihi in Christo
Thomam Chafyn Gentilman, Robertum Wilkinson, Thomam Hawbury, Edwardum Browet,
Thomam Leder and Thomam Dele meos veros and legitimos Attornatos conjunctim and
divisim ad intrandum in omnia praedicta maneria, terras, tenementa, redditus,
reversiones and proficua and caetera praemissa, exceptis praeexceptis, and ad
deliberandum seisinam de and in eisdem Maneriis, terris and tenementis, and
caeteris praemissis cum pertinentiis, exceptis praeexceptis, praefatis Roberto
Wittelbury, Willielmo Marbury, Willielmo Field, Roberto Bayston, Thomae Montegu
and Johanni Freeman, haeredibus and assignatis suis secundum vim, formam and
effectum hujus praesentis Cartae inde, ratum and gratum habens and habiturus
totum and quicquid dicti Attornati mei sive eorum aliquis nomine meo fecerit in
praemissis, seu in aliquo praemissorum. In cujus rei Testimonium huic praesenti
Cartae meae Sigillum apposui, hiis testibus Georgio Comite Kantiae, Johanne
Gray Domino de Wilton, Thoma Green Milite, Johanne Wake Milite, and multis
aliis.

Dat' vicesimo quarto die mensis Maii, Anno Regni Regis Henrici Septimi post
Conquestum Angliae nono.
Carta Edwardi Comitis Wilts.
EDwardus Comes Wilts
Omnibus ad quos praesens Scriptum pervenerit Salutem in Domino sempiternam.
Sciatis Nos praefatum Edwardum tum pro bono and fideli servitio Nobis per
Dilectum nostrum Willielmum Pemberton impensum quam imposterum impendendum tam
tempore pacis quam tempore guerrae, dedisse and per praesens Scriptum nostrum
concessisse praefato Willielmo unum annualem redditum sive feodum centum
solidorum legalis monetae Angliae recipiendum annuatim de and in omnibus terris
and tenementis nostris in Ranes in Comitatu Northamptoniae cum pertinentiis per
manus Receptorum, Ballivorum, Firmariorum seu aliorum occupatorum pro tempore
existent' pro termino vitae dicti Willielmi, videlicet ad festa Paschae and
Sancti Michaelis Archangeli per aequales portiones; Et si contingat dictum
annualem redditum sive feodum centum solidorum sive aliquam inde parcellam
aretro fore in part vel in toto post aliquod festum festorum praedictorum per
unum mensem durante vita dicti Willielmi, tunc been licebit praefato Willielmo
and assignatis suis in dictis terris and tenementis praedictis cum pertinentiis
and qualibet inde parcella intrare and distringere, and districtiones sic
captas abducere, asportare, effugare, and penes se retinere quousque de
praedicto annuali redditu sive feodo centum solidorum and qualibet inde
parcella cum arreragiis, misis and expensis ejusdem si quae fuerint, eidem
Willielmo plenarie fuerit satisfactum and persolutum. In cujus rei testimonium
praesentibus Sigillum nostrum apposuimus.

Dat' apud Manerium nostrum de Drayton sexto die Martii, Anno Regni Regis
Henrci Septimi post Conquestum duodecimo.
Carta Regis Henrici Septimi.
HEnricus Dei gratia Rex Angliae and Franciae and Dominus Hiberniae
Omnibus ad quos praesentes Literae pervenerint Salutem.
Sciatis quod Nos de gratia nostra speciali ac ex certa scientia and mero motu
nostris concessimus and licentiam dedimus pro Nobis and haeredibus nostris
quantum in Nobis est, Edwardo Comiti Wilts, quod ipse seu Executores sui seu
eorum aliquis vel aliqui ad laudem Dei and divini cultus augmentum duas
Cantarias videlicet unam Cantariam perpetuam de duobis Capellanis divina in
Ecclesia parochiali Sancti Petri de Luffwyck in Comitatu Northamptoniae, and
aliam Cantariam perpetuam de uno Capellano in Ecclesiae beatae Mariae de
Plasshe in Comitatu Essexiae pro salubri statu nostro and carissimae consortis
nostrae Elizabethae Reginae Angliae dum vixerimus, and pro animabus nostris cum
ab hac luce migravimus, ac pro animabus Johannis nuper Comitis Wilts and
Constanciae uxoris suae parentum ipsius Edwardi nunc Comitis, ac pro animabus
Henrici Green and Margaretae uxoris ejus parentum ipsius Constanciae, ac pro
animabus omnium fidelium defunctorum juxta ordinationem ipsius nunc Comitis vel
Executorum suorum aut eorum alicujus in hac part fiendas celebraturis facere,
fundare, erigere, creare and stabilire possit and possint futuris temporibus
duraturam: Et pro Cantaria in dicta Ecclesia Sancti Petri de Luffwyck, cum sic
erecta, facta, fundata, creata and stabilita fuerit, Cantaria Edwardi Comitis
Wilts in Ecclesia parochiali Sancti Petri de Luffwyck pro perpetuo nuncupetur.
Et quod Capellani Cantariae illius and successores sui Capellani ejusdem
Cantariae sint bonum corpus corporatum in re and nomine, habeantque
successionem perpetuam, and sint personae habiles and capaces in lege; Et quod
Capellani ejusdem Cantariae and successores sui Capellani Cantariae illius per
nomen and sub nomine Capellanorum Comitis Wilts in Ecclesia parochiali Sancti
Petri de Luffwyck placitare possint and implacitari, Necnon omnimodas actiones,
sectas, querelas and causas reales, personales and mixtas cujuscunque generis
fuerint and naturae, coram quibuscunque Justiciariis, Judicibus spiritualibus
and secularibus seu aliis personis quibuscunque prosequi, ac in eisdem
respondere and responderi, easque defendere possint, Ac per idem nomen terras
ac tenementa ac alias possessiones and res quascunque peragere, habere, gaudere
